articles.author: Jon Porter
articles.title: Apple forced to add iPhone and MacBook repairability scores to comply with French law - The Verge
articles.description: Apple has added repairability scores to its iPhone and MacBooks on its French online store. It’s in response to a new French law that came into effect this year, and give information including how easy a device is to disassemble.
articles.content:
The new law is designed to reduce waste
The repairability score can be seen on the lower right of the product page.
Screenshot: Apple.com
